page.title: 06 Edge View Hospital
page.content: 1975 started as 30 bedded Health Service Hospital.1977 changed into a community unit ,10 places set aside for blind people since opening. A research project into blind peoples needs was commenced, managed by BIMH and financed by DHSS.The 20 places left were used as following :10-12 places medium to long term ,6-8 short term . An out-hous e was made into a 3 bedroomed holiday chalet with the help of funds from a local charity. Families have to pay 2.50 a day per person. The chalet is now booked from March to October continuously.The hospital has a clinic- al assistant twice a week an Emergancy Cover GP once a week and a consultant once a week.One of the outhouses is used for pottery.Residents learn basic skills at LEA evening classes.
